title: 111_hr1688
content: Upon retirement for service in an active reserve status performed after attaining eligibility for regular retirement, individuals have the option to receive retired pay for non-regular service. (a) Election Authority; Requirements.--Section 12741 of title 10, United States Code, allows individuals to elect to receive retired pay under this chapter instead of other provisions if they meet specific requirements and served in the Selected Reserve of the Ready Reserve after becoming eligible for retirement. The Ready Reserve allows individuals to elect retired pay under specific requirements after serving in the Selected Reserve. The minimum two-year service requirement can be reduced for certain positions. The Ready Reserve allows individuals to elect retired pay under specific requirements after serving in the Selected Reserve. The minimum two-year service requirement can be reduced for certain positions. Amendments are made to terminate retirement eligibility and entitlement to retired or retainer pay under specific chapters if the minimum years of service were not completed due to termination or vacancy of appointment. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to reflect a new variable age requirement for retirement. Amendments are made to retirement eligibility age requirements for service in the Selected Reserve of the Ready Reserve. Clerical amendments include changes to section headings and the table of sections in the relevant title. Amendments are made to retirement eligibility age requirements for service in the Selected Reserve of the Ready Reserve, including changes to section headings and the table of sections in the relevant title. The new item is inserted in relation to section 12741. Amendments are made to retirement eligibility age requirements for service in the Selected Reserve of the Ready Reserve, including changes to section headings and the table of sections in the relevant title. A new item is inserted in relation to section 12741, allowing for retirement for service in the Selected Reserve of the Ready Reserve after eligibility for regular retirement. The amendments made by this section shall take effect as of January 1, 2008. Amendments to retirement eligibility age requirements for service in the Selected Reserve of the Ready Reserve include recomputation of retired pay for members recalled to active status in the Selected Reserve after completing two years of service. The Secretary concerned may reduce the service requirement for certain positions. Amendments to retirement eligibility age requirements for service in the Selected Reserve of the Ready Reserve include recomputation of retired pay for members recalled to active status in the Selected Reserve after completing two years of service. The Secretary concerned may reduce the service requirement for certain positions, allowing for an adjustment in retired grade for members recalled to active status in the Selected Reserve. Amendments allow for the reduction of service requirements for certain positions in the Selected Reserve, enabling members to adjust their retired grade if recalled to active status. Amendments allowing for reduced service requirements in the Selected Reserve took effect on January 1, 2008.
